titleStmt.title: J. A. Williams et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6021

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
James town Ky
December the 17th 1864
Your Excellency
Gov Thomas E Bramlette

Sir at the last term of the Russell Circuit Court there was a fine assessed against Frederick Conn under an indictment for tipling amounting to the sum of Sixty dollars in cludeing an atto fee of $18 -- which fine the said Conn is unable to pay and there is a writ in the hands of the sheriff of said county requiring the arrest and imprisonment of the said Conn If he does not replevy or pay off the Judgment afore said We the undersigned citizens and friends to humanity respectfully represent to your honor that the said Conn has abandoned the profession of tipling and is an honest up right gentlemen whos object is not to violate the laws of the land -- but necessity prompted him to deal in liquers at a time when the laws seemd to be entirely suspended in consequence of the war the said Conn has a large family to support and is not able to laber he has been afflicted and diseased for years the most of the time not expected to live but a short time he is unable to pay the said fine or any part of it to do his destitute family Justice and further If the said Execution is enforced and the said Conn is imprisoned he cannot live agreate while oweing to his feeble health We therefore ask you to remit that portion due the commonwealth as the imprisonment of said Conn would in a short time send him to his grave
and We will vouch for the said con that this will be the last time We will ask your interposition in his be half ^in regard to tipling^ We are prompted by principals of humanity and nothing els and ask your favor through no other motive

J. A. Williams
G W Eubank
F B Swidwell
James McKiney
James Canedy
Isaac Rodgers
Theo Jones
A J Scott
John Crisp
Squire B Popplewell
Hugh Dalheney
Jesse wouldging

Russell Cir Ct
vs
F. Conn
$60.
Remitted
23d Dec/64

Dec 20
Gov Thos E. Bramlette
Frankfort
Kentucky
